lead_paragraph: American officials said that the military had lost contact with the boats in the Persian Gulf and that Iran had promised to return the sailors soon.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran, and Emmarie Huetteman from Washington.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and DAVID E. SANGER

snippet: American officials said that the military had lost contact with the boats in the Persian Gulf and that Iran had promised to return the sailors soon.

headline.main: Iran Seizes U.S. Sailors Amid Claims of Spying
headline.print_headline: Iran Seizes U.S. Sailors Amid Claims of Spying

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

abstract: Iranian authorities seize two United States patrol boats near Farsi Island, site of Iranian naval base, alleging that ships were there illegally and were 'snooping'; American authorities claim one of boats experienced mechanical failure while on routine mission; seizure of boats and crews comes at time of tension between nations, just days before nuclear deal is scheduled to take effect.
